name: Apple Slaw
description: This crisp and refreshing apple slaw is the perfect easy side dish for weeknight meals or potlucks during the fall season.

recipeInstructions.text: Mix the mayonnaise, Dijon, honey, vinegar, salt, and pepper to make a dressing.
recipeInstructions.name: Mix the mayonnaise, Dijon, honey, vinegar, salt, and pepper to make a dressing.

recipeInstructions.text: Shred or thinly slice the cabbage into 2-inch by ¼-inch strips. Shred or slice the carrots into 2-inch by ⅛-inch strips. Peel and core the apples. Shred or slice them into 2-inch by ⅛-inch strips and keep them in water with lemon juice or vinegar added, so they don't brown.** Cut the green onions on the diagonal into 1/8-inch thick slices.
recipeInstructions.name: Shred or thinly slice the cabbage into 2-inch by ¼-inch strips. Shred or slice the carrots into 2-inch by ⅛-inch strips. Peel and core the apples. Shred or slice them into 2-inch by ⅛-inch strips and keep them in water with lemon juice or vinegar added, so they don't brown.** Cut the green onions on the diagonal into 1/8-inch thick slices.

recipeInstructions.text: Mix the apples and vegetables with the dressing in a large bowl. If necessary, add more salt to taste.
recipeInstructions.name: Mix the apples and vegetables with the dressing in a large bowl. If necessary, add more salt to taste.

recipeInstructions.text: Keep the salad refrigerated until ready to serve. Mix before serving, and add more salt to taste.
recipeInstructions.name: Keep the salad refrigerated until ready to serve. Mix before serving, and add more salt to taste.

review.reviewBody: Love it! Pretty easy to make, and a great lunch side for sandwiches.
This was a really nice alternative to the traditional coleslaw mix. We had it with pulled pork tacos and it was a really good combination.
This was delicious! I used a bag of store prepped coleslaw mix for the cabbage.
